Denkm. 24); ´[[מ]] abs. 2Ki 18:22 + 223 t., [[הַמִּזְבֵָּחָה]] Ex 29:13 + 31 t.; cstr. [[מִזְבַּח]] Ex 20:24 + 76 t., sf. [[מִזְבְּחִי]] Ex 20:26 + 7 t., [[מִזְבַּחֲךָ]] 1Ki 8:31 + 3 t., [[מִזְבְּחֶָךָ]] De 33:10; [[מִזְבְּחוֹ]] Ju Jdg 6:31 + 2 t.; pl. [[מִזְבְּחׂת]] Nu 23:1 + 5 t., [[מִזְבְּחוֹת]] 2Ki 21:3 + 23 t., sf. [[מִזְבְּחוֹתֶיךָ]] Ps 84:4, other sfs. 21 t.;—

JE narrate that altars were built by Noah after leaving the ark Ge 8:20; by Abraham at Shechem Ge 12:7, Bethel Ge 12:8, Hebron Ge 13:18, mt. in land Moriah Ge 22:9; by Issac at Beersheba Ge 26:25; by Jacob at Shechem Ge 33:20 (yet this perh. mistake for [[מַצֵּבָה]], being obj. of [[וַיַּצֶּב־שָׁם]], not elsewhere with [[מזבח]], cf. also Di), at Bethel Ge 35:7, by Moses at Rephidim Ex 17:15, Horeb Ex 24:4, by Balak at Bamoth Baal, Pisgah, & Peor Nu 23:1, Nu 23:14, Nu 23:29; by Joshua on Mt. Ebal Jos 8:30: the prophetic histories narrate that altars were built by Gideon at Ophra Ju Jdg 6:24; by a man of God at Bethel Ju Jdg 21:4; by Samuel at Ramah 1Sa 7:17; by Saul after Michmash 1Sa 14:35; by David on the threshing floor of Ornan 2Sa 24:25 = 1Ch 21:18, 1Ch 22:1; that Solomon sacrificed on the altar at Gibeon 1Ki 3:4 and built altars in the temple at Jerusalem 1Ki 6:20, 1Ki 8:64; that Jeroboam built an altar at Bethel 1Ki 12:32 (which was destroyed by Josiah 2Ki 23:15); and that Elijah repaired an ancient altar on Carmel 1Ki 18:30. An altar in Egypt is predicted Is 19:19. All this accords with the law of the Covenant code Ex 20:24–26 which recognises a plurality of altars and prescribes that they shall be built of [[אֲדָמָה]], or of unhewn stones, and without steps. So [[אֲבָנִים]] De 27:6 (JE), [[אֲבָנִים]] [[שְׁלֵמוֹת]] Jos 8:31, and twelve stones 1Ki 18:30, 1Ki 18:32; cf. Is 27:9. The altar was also a place of refuge Ex 21:24 (JE) 1Ki 1:50, 1Ki 1:51, 1Ki 2:28.
D prescribes one central altar De 12:5 f. 27; but no attempt to enforce this principle appears before Hezekiah (2Ki 18:4, 2Ki 18:22), and Josiah, whose reform is more effectual, 2Ki 23:8–2Ki 23:20.

P limits sacrifices to the altars of the tabernacle. A great altar was built E. of the Jordan, but it was according to P only as an [[עֵד]] after the pattern of the altar before the Tabernacle Jos 22:10–34. P describes two altars:

after the return Jeshua built an altar on the ancient site in the court of the temple Ezr 3:2.

besides these altars used in the worship of Yahweh, Ahab built an altar to Baal in Samaria 1Ki 16:32; Ahaz made an altar on the roof of the upper chamber, and other kings of Judah made altars in the two courts, all of which were destroyed by Josiah 2Ki 23:12.

the ancient and most common term for making altars was [[בָּנׇה]] Ge 35:7 (E) Ge 8:20 (J) De 27:5, De 27:6, Ex 32:5 (JE) +, implying building material; other vbs. are [[הֵקִים]] 2Sa 24:18, 1Ki 16:32, 2Ki 21:3, 1Ch 21:18, 2Ch 33:3; [[הֵכִין]] Ezr 3:3 (sq. the horns of the altar were especially for the application of the blood of the sin-offering in the ritual; sin is represented as graven [[לְקַרְנוֹת מִזְבְּחוֹתֵיכֶם]] Je 17:1; therefore of blood for cleansing it was said † ´[[נׇתַן על קרנות המ]] Ex 29:12, Le 4:7, Le 4:18, Le 4:25, Le 4:30, Le 4:34, Le 8:15, Le 9:9, Le 16:18 (all P). An ancient custom is referred to, Ps 118:27 [[אִסְרו־חַג]] [[בַּעֲבׂתִָים עַד־קרנות המזבח]] bind the festal victim with cords, unto the horns of the altar: Ainsworth paraphrases: ‘ that is, all the court over, untill you come even to the hornes of the altar, intending hereby many sacrifices, ’ so De; but Che ‘ bind the procession with branches, (step on) to the altar-horns, ’ that is in sacred procession round the altar.

the [[יְסוֹד]] (q.v.) is also referred to in the ritual of the sin-offerings in the phrases [[יׇחַק אל יסוד]] Le 8:15, Le 9:9 & [[שָׁפַךְ אל יסוד]] Ex 29:12, Le 4:7, Le 4:18, Le 4:25, Le 4:30, Le 4:34 (all P) [[יִמָּחֵה]] [[אל יסוד]] Le 5:9.

the altar was [[קׂדֶשׁ קָדָשִׁים]] Ex 29:37, Ex 40:10 (P); but repeated sin-offerings were necessary to keep it pure and cleanse it from the pollution of the people in whose midst it was situated. This is expressed by [[חִטֵּא]] Le 8:15 (P) Ez Eze 43:22; [[כִּפֶּר]] Le 16:20, Le 16:33 (P) Ez Eze 43:26; [[קִדַּשׁ]] Ex 29:44, Ex 40:10, Le 8:15, Nu 7:1 (P); [[טִהַר]] 2Ch 29:18.
